concept.title: Quick Reference Schedules
concept.shortdesc: Quick references provide a brief one or two-page schedule for students to quickly see time-related issues such as lesson postings, quiz deadlines, and assignment postings.

conbody.p: Because there is no structured class schedule to help students remain organized in a virtual classroom, the quick reference helps them remain organized and pay attention to deadlines without having to constantly look through the comprehensive syllabus.

Quick references are based on semester type (regular semester, summer session, and winter session). These semester types are similar in terms of what topics and deadlines are assigned for each lesson; however, they differ in how deadlines are assigned based on number of weeks (and therefore lesson frequency) in the course. For example, in a regular semester course it is easy to assign students a major deadline for the following lesson because that lesson is scheduled for the following week. However, the same deadline would be more difficult in a winter session because the next lesson could be the very next day.
